item.title: By: Tourist
item.dc:creator: Tourist
item.description: <p>I don't see any changes. Nice work</p>
item.content:encoded: I don’t see any changes. Nice work

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>I've actually been using the private version of Gmail for over a year now. I used to run my own Domino server for mail but maintaining it, especially for a non-admin such as myself was taking way too much time. I do still run a server but it is purely for apps these days.<br /><br />I use the Gmail browser interface in partnership with the Mobile client on my mobile phone given that I am never really offline!<br /><br />If your email demands aren't serious then I'd definitely recommend having a look.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’ve actually been using the private version of Gmail for over a year now. I used to run my own Domino server for mail but maintaining it, especially for a non-admin such as myself was taking way too much time. I do still run a server but it is purely for apps these days.

I use the Gmail browser interface in partnership with the Mobile client on my mobile phone given that I am never really offline!

If your email demands aren’t serious then I’d definitely recommend having a look.

Matt

item.title: By: Robin Wills
item.dc:creator: Robin Wills
item.description: <p>So will you be reading your mail on-line the whole time or can you use IMAP/POP? I'm just interested that you don't use Domino even if that's a bit overkill for companies like ours?<br /><br />I still haven't checked out the Google Apps in any great detail. Rob.</p>
item.content:encoded:
So will you be reading your mail on-line the whole time or can you use IMAP/POP? I’m just interested that you don’t use Domino even if that’s a bit overkill for companies like ours?

I still haven’t checked out the Google Apps in any great detail. Rob.
